channel.title: Batch Files on a Mac
channel.description: Can anyone tell me how to run a batch (.bat) file on a Mac? I know that I need to run it in Java, but how do I do that?

item.title: Batch Files on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

“java -noverify -Xmx500m -cp /hd/users/name/MoparScape.jar bot 0
param 0 for highmem, 1 for lowmem, another 0 to make the song not startup” then i changed " “/hd/users/name/”=the folder were the class or jar is located. that would be the way to run the moparscape jar.it worked for me but thats and mac os x 10.3.9. sry if it doesnt work

Read full topic

item.title: Batch Files on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @Efete Efete
item.description:
@Efete wrote:

ya use terminal. or get xcode and code and app the run the server id code but id need someone to teach me sry
What do I type in Terminal?

Read full topic

item.title: Batch Files on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

i posted up under my first post with the quotes if you read they idk.[quote=“xryz, post:4, topic:195328”]macs and pc are oppisites but setting up a server is very similary to setting up one on xp. you got to portforward past the firewall. im going to try mamp but i havent yet. right now i have a mac os x 10.3.9 ppc g3 , 400 something mb of ram, 300mhz cpu, 155mb left out of 6gb hd, and its pretty fast. but im not going to use this mac b/c its old but if i had mac tiger or leopard on a powerful computer most defintly better than xp. if you nd any help i might be able to help with mac stuff but knowledge on mac and pc are like 50:50 so ya. and you might check on java.sun.com i seen something on there. the other reason is that pc and mac archive diffirent e.i. (pc=C:\ mac=/hard drive name/users/name/ ). so it does sorta make a big diffence. sry if i confused anyone dont get mad.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 01, 2008, 09:06:00 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Efete link=topic=259775.msg2154245#msg2154245 date=1207116896]
Can anyone tell me how to run a batch (.bat) file on a Mac? I know that I need to run it in Java, but how do I do that?
[/quote]ya use terminal. or get xcode and code and app the run the server id code but id need someone to teach me sry[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 01, 2008, 10:07:19 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Efete link=topic=259775.msg2154245#msg2154245 date=1207116896]
Can anyone tell me how to run a batch (.bat) file on a Mac? I know that I need to run it in Java, but how do I do that?
[/quote] for a run client.bat itook out all but the main code “java -noverify -Xmx500m -cp .:/MoparScape.jar bot 0
param 0 for highmem, 1 for lowmem, another 0 to make the song not startup” then i changed ". to the dir e.i. /hd/users/name/ . and it worked for me i keep the “.bat” but all it needs is ran in the teminal[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Batch Files on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @Efete Efete
item.description:
@Efete wrote:

[quote=“xryz”]macs and pc are oppisites but setting up a server is very similary to setting up one on xp. you got to portforward past the firewall. im going to try mamp but i havent yet. right now i have a mac os x 10.3.9 ppc g3 , 400 something mb of ram, 300mhz cpu, 155mb left out of 6gb hd, and its pretty fast. but im not going to use this mac b/c its old but if i had mac tiger or leopard on a powerful computer most defintly better than xp. if you nd any help i might be able to help with mac stuff but knowledge on mac and pc are like 50:50 so ya. and you might check on java.sun.com i seen something on there. the other reason is that pc and mac archive diffirent e.i. (pc=C:\ mac=/hard drive name/users/name/ ). so it does sorta make a big diffence. sry if i confused anyone dont get mad.[/quote] I know that Macs and PC’s are different, but how do I run batch files (i.e. runserver.bat)?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2008, 02:07:31 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Username, post:3, topic:195328”]Use terminal. No it is not “extremely hard” macs are built to pro java standards. It’s “extremely hard” to you because you have no knowledge.[/quote] I don’t have a PC to run it on[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2008, 02:08:23 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Username, post:3, topic:195328”]Use terminal. No it is not “extremely hard” macs are built to pro java standards. It’s “extremely hard” to you because you have no knowledge.[/quote] Tell me what to type in terminal and I’ll do it. I don’t have any knowledge because I’m new. So if you’re so smart, why don’t you tell me how to do this?

Read full topic
